titleStmt.title: The speech of an honest Common-council man Mr. Chairman, the discent from France, I confess finds more credit with me than I was willing at first to give it; and from the just apprehension I have of the consequences of it, I now rise to speak; ...
titleStmt.author: Honest Council-man.

notesStmt.note: Title from caption title and first lines of text.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
